entries.next: I don't have anything for you just now. If you want more work you should go to Moenia and talk to Borvo.
entries.cantwork: Talk to me again once you've finished with your current employer.
entries.npc_reset_1: I'll keep the job open, so check back when you feel inclined to give it another try.
entries.npc_1_1: Very wise, speaking with me. You could do much worse than ally yourself with Borvo the Hutt. I'm his lieutenant. If you're interested in earning credits, I happen to be missing a courier. That's the problem with so many beings in this line of work -- they're unreliable. Interested in making the drop in his place?
entries.npc_2_1: Wonderful. You'll be giving this package to an Imperial courier, so I doubt you'll have any legal trouble. However, you may run into tedious busybodies from Kritus Morven's gang. See me once you've finished.
entries.npc_3_1: What a fine upstanding citizen you are. Now you'd better run along --people might get the wrong impression about you if they see you talking to me.
entries.npc_4_1: If you have to ask... actually nothing too illegal. A certain Imperial official has a taste for Kassoti spice. Borvo wants to meet the needs of all his friends in the Empire.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: Did you change your mind about delivering that spice?
entries.npc_reward_1: Good job. I think I could find more work for you soon.
entries.npc_work_1: Were you going to deliver that spice or just hang onto it?
entries.npc_noloc_1: The Imperial courier will contact us once he's set out for the rendezvous. Check back in a while.
entries.npc_failure_1: You didn't deliver the spice? Borvo will be sorely disappointed.
entries.dontknowyou_1: Just go on about your business.
entries.npc_smuggle_1: Thank you, citizen. I'll take it from here.
entries.gotowork_1: You were supposed to bring me some spice? What happened to it?
entries.notit_1: I'm pretty sure you were supposed to give me a different package.
entries.player_reset_1: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_1: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_3_1: What sort of delivery is this?
entries.npc_1_2: A local official who the boss did a big favor is sending a thank-you gift to him. You're new to the organization, so nobody would associate you with us yet. Would you mind picking up this package?
entries.npc_2_2: Glad to have you working with us. Meet Imperial courier Val Tula. She'll have a datadisc for you. It's a valuable item, so watch yourself once you make the pickup.
entries.npc_3_2: You think you can just say no? Is that what you really think? Well -- that's true. Now get lost.
entries.npc_4_2: Just to protect that official. Borvo has a -- reputation, and the authorities tend to keep an eye on his known associates. Nobody will give you a second look. No offense.
entries.npc_backtowork_2: Were you going to pick up the goods, or do you just want out?
entries.npc_reward_2: You seem to handle yourself pretty well. Keep up the good work and there may be a place for you in our organization.
entries.npc_work_2: Did you pick up that package yet? The boss was wondering where it was.
entries.npc_noloc_2: The courier will contact us as soon as he leaves. See me again in a while and I should know more.
entries.npc_failure_2: I'm sorry you couldn't finish the job. Don't worry, though, the boss is a forgiving sort -- at least by Hutt standards.
entries.otherescort_2: I'm waiting here for somebody else.
entries.dontknowyou_2: I'm waiting here for somebody else.
entries.npc_breech_2: Are you the courier I'm supposed to meet?
entries.npc_smuggle_2: Not to worry. All these codes are squeaky clean.
entries.notit_2: This is not the item you were supposed to give me.
entries.player_reset_2: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_2: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_3_2: Why is it important that I not be associated with you?
entries.npc_1_3: You don't have a problem dealing with Gungans, do you? Personally I can't understand a blasted thing they say, but the boss has a soft spot for them. One of them, named Mubarr, owes us a little money and hasn't been coming around to make his payments. Would you mind collecting for us?
entries.npc_2_3: I figured you could handle this one easy. Just find Mubarr and explain the problem to him. If he doesn't cooperate -- you do what you have to.
entries.npc_3_3: I guess you're just the softhearted type -- or maybe you can't understand them either.
entries.npc_4_3: Our slicers tell me Mubarr's bank records show he has the money. Just be sure to get his bank codes so we can extract a late fee and, of course, your payment.
entries.npc_backtowork_3: Are you going to collect from that Gungan or are you giving up?
entries.npc_reward_3: Good work. Can you believe how that guy would try to ignore his obligations to the boss? It breaks my heart.
entries.npc_work_3: So did you collect from that Gungan yet, or what?
entries.npc_noloc_3: We've got a guy tailing Mubarr. When he's somewhere we can meet him privately, he'll send word. See me in a while.
entries.npc_failure_3: You didn't collect? Someone has to collect from him or we're gonna look like suckers. That's not good in our business.
entries.otherescort_3: Yousa bein' in da wrong place to meet yousa friend.
entries.dontknowyou_3: Mesa no liken yous outlaunder. Off wit yousa.
entries.npc_breech_3: Mesa no liken de interest. Mesa be crunchin' yous, not be skeered of yousa none.
entries.player_reset_3: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_3: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_3_3: How am I supposed to collect it if he doesn't have it?
entries.npc_1_4: You are in a position to do Borvo a great service. His majordomo has been taken captive by his rival, Kritus Morven. We want her back, urgently, and we want you to get her.
entries.npc_2_4: Her name is Xan'lac, and she's a Twi'lek. Feel free to kill any non-Twi'leks in her vicinity. Be careful of her though -- she's a very valuable resource.
entries.npc_3_4: This is a bad time to turn me down. Certainly not the act of a friend.
entries.npc_4_4: Let's just say she's an integral part of our accounting process. The specifics of her job are not pertinent. We just want her back as soon as possible.
entries.npc_backtowork_4: You know everything I can tell you. Or were you having second thoughts?
entries.npc_reward_4: You have done a great service to our organization. You deserve a vacation -- Moenia perhaps. Borvo lives there. Maybe you might stop in and visit him.
entries.npc_work_4: If you were wondering when is the right time to make that rescue -- the answer is "now."
entries.npc_noloc_4: I need to make some quick back-up arrangements. Check back in a few minutes. I hope to have everything prepared.
entries.npc_failure_4: You didn't rescue her? I guess we move to Plan B.
entries.otherescort_4: I'm not the one you seek. A pity, really.
entries.dontknowyou_4: Don't you have business of your own to attend to?
entries.npc_takeme_4: I'm relieved to see you. You're good at what you do.
entries.npc_dropoff_4: You've been a wonderful companion. Thank you for getting me here safely.
entries.player_reset_4: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_4: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_3_4: What does a majordomo do, exactly?
entries.player_reset_5: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_5: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.player_reset_6: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_6: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.npc_reset_2: I'll keep the job open, so check back when you feel inclined to give it another try.
entries.npc_reset_3: I'll keep the job open, so check back when you feel inclined to give it another try.
entries.npc_reset_4: I'll keep the job open, so check back when you feel inclined to give it another try.
entries.npc_reset_5: I'll keep the job open, so check back when you feel inclined to give it another try.
entries.npc_reset_6: I'll keep the job open, so check back when you feel inclined to give it another try.
